Control Name: 5.13.2 All APIs in this workload require clients to authenticate.
Control Statement: API URLs used by client applications are exposed to attackers (JavaScript code on a website can be viewed, mobile application can be decompiled and inspected) and should be protected. For internal APIs, requiring authentication can increase the difficulty of lateral movement if an attacker obtains network access. Typical mechanisms include API keys, authorization tokens, IP restrictions or Azure Managed identities.
